title: Wtf is Riot thinking on Ornn?
body:
Okay...... I'm getting a headache here.....

A Summary of what Ornn is going to have/do:

- Living Forge will no longer cost gold to upgrade items, BUT, will work like Zilean's XP boost..... and Channel to activate on an ally (antsy teams.....), and is eligible at level 11.

-W no longer gives a shield...........

-W net gains + 5 Seconds to its end cooldown......




In other words: No Sustain. But hey..... if you get to level 11, you can upgrade people's items........

Ornn's shield was the only reason he was even VIABLE.

Now he's going to die in 2 seconds, and can't even top lane.

But hey...... free item upgrades....

-No Jungling (Can't tank enough)
-No Support (Poked out of lane)
-No Turret Turtling.... (Because now anyone can dive him...)



What is Riot thinking, doing this to a friggin 47% win champ?

replies.body: They gave him unstoppable back tho.
i think they are looking into giving his unstoppableness back on his dash skill
Removing his shield was a good idea, no reason for every champ to have sustain, Definetely not a tank

He is NOT a Tank. Nothing about his kit scales as a tank except DAMAGE. His entire premise as a tank was about his shield. Otherwise, He's basically a fighter with no AD scaling except on Q.

I had more success on him building {{item:3078}} {{item:3071}} than ANY tank build, and I had Mastery 7 on Day 2 of his release.

Ornn has CC on all his abilities and can easily ragdoll squishies into submission.

He’s a tank.
The only reason he ever could kill ANY squishies was his shield. Once the shield's gone, squishies beat Ornn every single time, unless they were standing next to a wall.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0U6B986W,comment-id=0004000000010000,timestamp=2018-11-07T19:32:55.830+0000)
>
> The only reason he ever could kill ANY squishies was his shield. Once the shield's gone, squishies beat Ornn every single time, unless they were standing next to a wall.

He shouldn’t be able to kill a number squishies come late game. DPS should shred him. Ornn’s shield is necessary, but his power was his CC, not damage. After a certain point, damage dealers **should** beat him.

And they COULD...... unless they stood next to walls..... And it had to be walls at the right angle.... Unlike {{champion:78}} , Ornn doesn't have a way to position himself to Gap close. Q is delayed, and wall knocks are unreliably versus people who know his basic mechanics. He can't change the angle between him and his opponent.

"Should" is a pretty subjective term, btw. Are you saying that a skill-less, overloaded adc should be able to kill someone whose mechanically outplaying them? Or are you saying, that when Ornn and a squishy duel, the squishy should win some of the time? 

I mean..... I've used another example before:

On {{champion:14}} about 4 months back, I jungled a {{champion:222}} into a 0/9 state of game.... she had no kills at all, died 9 times in a row, never got her farm.....

...... And then my team gave her a triple at about 17:00.

Suddenly Jinx had {{item:3031}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3095}} and proceeded to 1v5 the very team that put her down 0/9.

I had 5500 HP as Sion, substantially tanky, and substantial damage.

Jinx proceeded to begin melting me in 4 seconds, with no escape possible.

I went from 9/2/9 to 11/9/12 and she went from 0/9/2 to 11/9/7.

Is that what you're defending? Getting outplayed an entire game only to come back and end a game in 5 minutes because of an overloaded champ getting a triple?

Dps is supposed to beat tanks with proper positioning. Through and through. That’s how the triangle works: burst beats dps, dps beats tank, tank beats burst. This is assuming players of equal skill of course. 

You saying “skill-less, overloaded adc” is also dishonest. Vast majority of adcs are not no skill. Maybe because the majority of their damage is all in autos, but they have to pay attention to the same postioning that you say Ornn has to pay attention to. 

> Q is delayed, and wall knocks are unreliably versus people who know his basic mechanics.

This is what made his E knockups so impactful and rewarding.

Anyway, your Sion example leaves out a lot. How much farm had Jinx been fetting that she could all of a sudden purchase a Stormrazor, runaan’s, and IE after just a triple? What build were you running? All you said was you had 5500 health as sion with sibstantial tankiness and damage, what other items did you have? Any actual armor? Why not a Randuin’s to make her attack slower? 

There’s no way an adc with no escapes 1v5’d your team. I don’t buy that one bit. But, she’s also a hypercarry, and the fact that she got that fed says something about how you played and how long you dragged out the match. An 0/9/2 Jinx should not be able to stop your sieges, so what happened that you couldn’t close?

But no, I’m defending that dps, when run by someone of equal skill to yourself should easily be able to handle Ornn unless massively immobile. An adc or other squishy champ that disrespects will take punishment, but in the end, dps wins, and tanks like Ornn should have less kill pressure when their power is in CC.

1) you need to leave your triangle at the door. You're arguing only adcs should ever win mid - late game. You're saying the game should NOT have tanks and in fact no way to even make tanks viable mid - late game..

2) Lmfao. As soon as Prestige Kai Sa came out, I picked her up for the very first time (never played her) and went 19/13/20. Such "Skill." I also pull the same when I play Jinx, and I do NOT play adc. I also do the same on Ezreal (The real reason Ez has such a high pick rate even though he's a crappy adc..... is because he's EASY for a non ADC fill).

I won't deny there are some adcs like Vayne, Tristana, which are skill picks..... but their win/losses have FAR more to do with deviant itemization vs meta itemization. if they follow the cookie cutter build, even their losses look like they've been playing the champ a long time.

3) My recollection was slightly off about the match. But I did have defensive items:

https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2847269884/243999882?tab=overview

(Jinx didn't get a single kill until just before 20 minutes! Her Relevant snowball didn't happen until 27 minutes).

You'll notice..... Jhin, I, and Blitz all had acceptable KDAs, and we had complete map control until that snowball. 

You really have no idea how fast some adcs close games.

I barely care for the rest of your argument after this:

> you need to leave your triangle at the door. You're arguing only adcs should ever win mid - late game. You're saying the game should NOT have tanks and in fact no way to even make tanks viable mid - late game..

Holy crap, way to put words in my mouth and completely misrepresent me. I have never said tanks should not be viable mid - late. That is drastic misrepresentation. Listen, tanks are my best and main class. 80% of my time in top lane is tanks. Same with Support. Jungle lately has been J4, but in more of a tanky capacity, but Maokai jungle is one my favorite junglers. Don’t you dare insinuate that I don’t want tanks viable. **EVER**.

I believe in balance, and the truth is that damage outscales defense, that’s how league was designed. Otherwise, tanks would rule with their defenses because dps would not be able to kill them. That triangle is the core of everything relating to tanks and damage dealers in almost every game. MMOs, tanks die more to consistent damage if they aren’t healed, and are set up in ways to take spike damage. You dare say I only want adcs to win, but in an ideal triangle system, adcs have to fear burst damage, aka assassins and burst mages. If they succeed, adcs can’t kill a tank. If burst can’t kill The adc, the adc will be anle to dps the tank and drop it between crits and %armor pen, should they be building it (which they should have to to deal with tanks).

As for your Kai’sa match. I found it, it’s also your only positive kda and win with her on op.gg, in a game that went to 60 Kills for both sides. That is ridiculous and way out of the norm for matches these days. That was a kill fest that lasted an hour. Matches don’t normally last that long these days, so I’m slightly curious as to why that couldn’t close out earlier, but at this point, not worth it.

1) Everything counters Tanks. it's not a triangle. Mages..... Adcs..... Assassins ALL tear a hole in tanks.

The ONLY type of champion not beating tanks right now..... are DoT champs. That's it. Literally it. DoT. Everything else slaughters tanks.

I don't care whether you play tanks or not. You are misrepresenting them.

Building Penetration should NEVER be foolproof. Yet it's ALWAYS foolproof. If someone builds Armor Penetration..... there should be counters to that. There aren't.

2) As I said, I pulled her out of the box and score a huge game with her. It wasn't because I was weak; It was because I had a feeding team, and I was the one keeping the lights on.

And..... it's not like ANY of my scores since then have been "bad." If you actually look at the game details, I won every lane exchange. But you can't carry int feeders, feeding hyper carries..... every. single. game.

40-60 minute games are indicative of a hyper carry in a team of bad players. "Way out of the Norm lol." It's normal for someone who doesn't surrender. Ever.

The only mages that really counter tanks are dps mages {{champion:268}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:13}}  and {{champion:161}}  because of his true damage, otherwise mages are mainly forced into kiting tanks while doing relatively insignificant damage (unless way ahead) to avoid their cc abilities.

A tank's main value they bring to the team is utility, CC/Engage {{champion:516}} R (or Q>E), {{champion:12}}  combo   {{champion:14}}  ult,  or disengage/utility {{champion:78}} W/R

Some take a little longer but they all apply.

Void staff pretty much mitigates Tank resist items when used on these champs. Void staff on Morgana doesn't do that at all.

Did you build 0 MR against some of those champs? Were they insanely fed? For Brand and Zyra, maybe even Ziggs and Xerath did you run {{item:3194}} ?

Just because this sounds like you built 0 MR, I did a calculation or two. If you built only {{item:3194}} {{item:3001}} against them as a level 11 Ornn, you’d have 153.1 MR, reducing their magic damage dealth 60.4%. If {{item:3379}}, just going off the passive adjust on PBE, you’d have 188.1 MR, reducing their damage by 65%. Now, add in {{item:3135}}, which grants 35% magic penetration. This takes your MR down to where you’d reduce damage by 49.9% and 55%, respectively with the items and values above. At that point, they need to deal twice your health in magic damage to kill you (cause damage is halved so they have to deal double than what they normally would have to against 0 MR so double your health). For DoT mages like Brand, his damage is cut a bit more because of {{item:3194}}.

So for a level 11 Ornn, that’s 2055 health with Adaptive and Abyssal, and 2255 with Adaptive and Infernal, Ignoring rune bonuses. So, these mages and assassins have to deal 4000-4500 damage in a short soan based on the items above. Not possible, especially not for the assassins unless insanely fed.

If you’re even and they aren’t insanely fed, and if actually buying MR, there is no reason most of those should destroy a tank in their rotations. *Especially* not {{champion:28}}, {{champion:105}}, {{champion:142}}, {{champion:55}}, and {{champion:43}}

P.S. I want you to look at my last Zyra game tonight (maybe). I did exactly what I just told you. I jungled Zyra vs Volibear, and the other team had a Nasus top, and they even had a fed Morg/Sivir.

I first item {{item:3135}} and won the game for my team, which systematically fed Voli too.

You do realize a Katarina Dagger does a base mid - late game damage of 800-900? She also prevents heals..... which is what most tanks sustain on these days.....

You really have no clue how Evelynn works if you think she doesn't delete tanks. Let me explain something to you:

Evelynn's E does % Max HP damage. Late game it alone can do about 80% of ANY champion's HP. If a target has 4500 HP, she can literally do 2400-2800 damage with E. Also, she, unlike other champs, has a Magic Penetration of 75%, so almost ALL of this damage goes through. Furthermore, at this point in the game, her ult can actually do 2400 MORE damage, because of AP scaling.

(It's not like Evelynn doesn't get 1024 AP or anything)

I also know Karma doesn't seem like a champ who can melt tanks but I can assure you she can. I have killed a Sejuani in 8 seconds with Karma. You just need to have the right items.... namely {{item:3135}} {{item:3151}} , and a lot of move speed items. A fully engaged Karma who isn't just spamming Q, can destroy tanks.

"The Sej/Zac treatment" now means "already pretty bad in casual play but still picked in pro so nerfed to troll pick" :^)

A lot of players complained about the removal of his unstoppable, so Riot is probably looking to put it back. I did like that portion of his W, so I don't mind it too much. He'll have to build slightly differently to make up for lack of sustain.
Build what pray tell? There isn't a single item in the game that can make up for the lack of the shield.

That will be up for testing. The unstoppable can now be used offensively so it might be better to build an offensive item early for an all in. Alternatively, he can build mostly the same because unstoppable makes him harder to gank.

Unstoppable doesn't make you harder to gank omfg. It's on a skill that prevents you from doing anything else! If you W, you cannot use ANYTHING to mitigate damage.

It's not like other champs who have Unstoppable where it serves a specific purpose.

Malph: Secures his ult
Darius: Secures his ult
Corki: Secures his Special Delivery
Hecarim: Secures his ult
Jarvan: Secures his ult
Kled: Secures his ult
Nocturne: Secures his ult
Shyvana: Secures her ult
Vi: Secures her ult
Warwick: Secures his ult, prevents displacement during his Q (Q being the ONLY exception to the rule, and only for displacements)
Zac: Secures his ult

See a pattern here?

The only champs who have Unstoppable are ones that need it to secure a gap closing ult, or in Corki's case, his extremely powerful, ult-like passive.

They all cross map distance. None of these champs actually uses it to mitigate damage, or prevent ganks. They enable killing moves.

_**Ornn's W is NOT a killing move, slows his movement speed, doesn't displace him or cross distances. What it does do, is slow him to 280 move speed, make him face a specific direction. Without a barrier, the only purpose of Unstoppable on Ornn's W is to basically prevent the skill itself from cancelling.**_

Which ...... already existed. In every single incarnation of Bellow's Breath, it has not been stoppable. Even when they removed Unstoppable, W was given a feature where "Crowd control does not interrupt the skill, but will stop the march"

Going into Bellows Breath is going to be a suicide button. Much like Ornn's E as an escape is a suicide button, because it slightly displaces him BACKWARDS, and has a windup to cast.

Trying to say this will make him harder to gank, means you don't understand Unstoppable.
----------------------
I'll give you an example of what Unstoppable used to do:

Day 2 of Ornn being out, I had a game versus a Veigar. Veigar's wall is extremely hard for Ornn to avoid, and even if you E it to destroy it, you'll still get stunned because of the rule "anything that touches it." So, W with unstoppable made this tradeoff a bit more survivable. You could W through the wall, to keep active, get stunned slightly on the other side of it, depending on your Tenacity level. But you had a shield to soak whatever Veigar hit you with, and you weren't standing still for his W. Even with the shield, it's a 50/50 interaction. That won't happen now.

Unstoppable can make you harder to gank simply due to displacement immunity. 

Ornn clearly doesn't have any more damage mitigation. Now it's CC mitigation. So you play him appropriately. You're still trying to think that he should have a shield, but he doesn't anymore. 

Also his brittle proc does a lot of damage, so I'd say the W isn't bad.

I want you to think for a second.

How many Knockup/Knockbacks/Irregular displacements actually affect an Ornn More than his own W does (You can do nothing while in W, not even change direction)

{{champion:266}} W Can't be displaced to the middle of the chains, but still is sitting prone to take Aatrox's beating.

{{champion:12}} Can't be knocked back, but is still primed to take Alistar's delayed Stun as soon as W ends.
